RichTextWidget.Text: Here you can pre define a battle plan which can then be used by pressing PgUp during a battle. There are five phases to a battle:
You can give new orders during the plan execution and that specific formation will disregard the plan from that point onward to follow your new command.
Prepare - Battle start before any sort of engagement.
Ranged - Marks the start of the engagement between ranged units.
Engage - From the moment troops are at a close distance (20 meters) to a few moments after they engage in melee.
Winning/Losing - At some point in the battle your troops will know whether they're winning or losing and will act accordingly.
Below you can find a list of all possibly orders:
Charge - your troops will advance at full speed torwards the enemy.
Hold Position - Your troops will remain in a defensible position close to where they stand.
Flank - your troops will position themselves to the side of the enemy party.
Skirmish - your troops will try to maintain a certain distance from the enemy.
Hide Behind - your troops will hide behind the main formation (Infantry I).
Protect Flank - your troops will position themselves to the side of your main party.
Advance - your troops will advance torwards the enemy.
Cautious Advance - your troops will start a slow and careful advance torwards the enemy.
